etymologies: mid 19th century: Greek, from pan ‘all’ + kratos ‘strength, mastery’. The modern sense dates from the 1970s

definitions: an ancient Greek sport that combined wrestling and boxing

examples.text: the original Olympic games featured events in running, pentathlon, and pankration

definitions: a modern martial art that incorporates techniques from wrestling and boxing

examples.text: she won a junior world title in pankration
after competing in pankration fights, Lucas won in his first official amateur MMA fight in August

shortDefinitions: modern martial art involving wrestling and boxing
